nl.esciencecenter.octopus

Interface OctopusPropertyDescription


  • public interface OctopusPropertyDescription

    OctopusPropertyDescription contains all necessary information about a property that is recognized by octopus or one of its components.

    Each OctopusPropertyDescription contains the following information:

    • A name that uniquely identifies the property. This name should be used as a key when passing properties to octopus in a Map.
    • A (human-readable) description that explains the use of the property.
    • The type of values that are accepted for the property (one of the OctopusPropertyDescription.Type enum). Even though it is customary to pass the values of properties as Strings, the user should ensure the values can be converted into the expected type.
    • The default value of the property.
    • The components by which this property is accepted (a Set of OctopusPropertyDescription.Component). Properties are only valid for certain components of octopus. For example, some properties may be used when creating an new Octopus, while others can be used when creating a new Scheduler, FileSystem, or Credential.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Maassen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  OctopusPropertyDescription.Component
      The Component enumeration lists all possible parts of octopus for which a property can be provided.
      static class  OctopusPropertyDescription.Type
      This Type enumeration lists all possible types of properties recognized by octopus.

      String getDefaultValue()

      Returns a human readable description of this property.

      Return a set containing all components that accept this property.

      Returns the name of the property.
      OctopusPropertyDescription.Type getType()
